Pandemic Electronic Benefit Transfer (P-EBT) is a one-time food benefit for families who lost access to free or reduced-price meals due to school closures. Eligible P-EBT families will receive application instructions from schools in late May. The P-EBT application will open the first week of June.

PARENT'S GUIDE TO MAP GROWTH

Arrow Academy uses a testing program called MAP Growth. The purpose of the test is to get an individualized assessment of where a student is performing academically. Students are tested at the beginning and end of each school year to keep track of their academic progress. Arrow Academy meets a student where they are academically and takes them to where they need to be.

Attached is an informative article from NWEA regarding MAP Growth for students. MAP Growth is a computer-adaptive test that measures what students know, regardless of grade level. Unlike standardized tests, MAP Growth adapts to each student's performance to give a more accurate representation of what they know.

NWEA is a non-profit organization that provides assessment solutions, insightful reports, professional learning offerings, and research services. Visit https://www.nwea.org/map-growth/for more information.

Each January, schools across the nation are invited to participate in the National Schools Poetry Project. Poems submitted by schools are reviewed by teachers/educators who select the poems based on the following criteria:
Overall quality of the poem based on student’s age and grade level based
• Creativity
• Age-appropriate language
• Sensory/figurative images
• Structure
• Poetic techniques
Congratulations to students from Mrs. Brown's 3rd and 4th grade English language arts classes! These young artists used their creative skill and imagination. Their works were submitted along with other young writers nationwide. Of the thirty-seven entries submitted by Odyssey Preparatory, eight young poets were selected for their works to be published in the next edition of the Young American Poetry Digest.
Congratulations to: Dylan Morris, Daniela Ortega, Autumn Bronson, Jordan Brown, Mya Johnson, Noemi Lara, Rebecca Lara, and T’Kyah Lloyd.
